title: Vestas Wind Systems Weekly News Summary
body:
**Vestas Reports Strong Q3 2025 Financial Results**

On November 5, 2025, Vestas Wind Systems A/S announced its third-quarter financial results, reporting a revenue of EUR 5.3 billion—a 3.1% increase compared to the same period in 2024. The EBIT margin before special items improved to 7.8%, up from 4.5% in Q3 2024. The company also reported an order intake of 4,606 MW, a 4% increase year-over-year, and a combined order backlog of EUR 68.2 billion. Based on these results, Vestas narrowed its full-year revenue guidance to between EUR 18.5 billion and EUR 19.5 billion, with an expected EBIT margin before special items of 5-6%. ([vestas.com](https://www.vestas.com/en/media/company-news/2025/vestas---interim-report--third-quarter-2025-c4261980?utm_source=openai))

**Analyst Ratings and Market Reactions**

JPMorgan reiterated its Overweight rating on Vestas stock, citing robust prospects for the company's onshore wind business despite recent concerns surrounding U.S. offshore wind projects. The investment bank highlighted the strong outlook for U.S. onshore wind, supported by favorable IRS guidelines, and identified the upcoming UK auction as a key catalyst that could provide visibility on offshore orders for 2026 and revenues for 2028-30. ([investing.com](https://www.investing.com/news/analyst-ratings/jpmorgan-reiterates-overweight-rating-on-vestas-stock-amid-strong-onshore-wind-outlook-93CH-4236495?utm_source=openai))

**Share Buyback Program Initiated**

In line with its capital structure strategy and solid liquidity position, Vestas announced a share buyback program of EUR 150 million. This initiative underscores the company's commitment to returning value to shareholders. ([vestas.com](https://www.vestas.com/content/dam/vestas-com/global/en/investor/reports-and-presentations/financial/2025/q3-2025/251105_23_Company%20Announcement.pdf.coredownload.inline.pdf?utm_source=openai))

key_points.text: Vestas reported a 3.1% increase in Q3 2025 revenue and improved EBIT margin, leading to a narrowed full-year revenue guidance.
JPMorgan reiterated its Overweight rating on Vestas, highlighting strong prospects for the company's onshore wind business.
Vestas initiated a EUR 150 million share buyback program, reflecting its commitment to returning value to shareholders.
